text:
hello everyone
I am new to Julia, but have extensive programming experience in python/cpp
I want to get started with Julia, I have gone through the basic syntax and want to get hands on the stdlib, through some exercise/tutorials, but I can't seem to find a one go solution for it
can someone point to some resources for the same?

elements.text:
hello everyone
I am new to Julia, but have extensive programming experience in python/cpp
I want to get started with Julia, I have gone through the basic syntax and want to get hands on the stdlib, through some exercise/tutorials, but I can't seem to find a one go solution for it
can someone point to some resources for the same?

text:
Well if you like video introductions i can recommend the videos from this course <https://github.com/mitmath/18337> by <@U69BL50BF>
especially the introductions to julia:
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-lJK92bEKow>
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M2i7sSRcSIw>
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10_Ukm9wr9g>
I think they give really good insight into what makes julia julia (type system, dispatch and so on).
Besides that i can really recommend reading the manual <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/>
It is really well written and since you’re all ready an experienced programmer will get a lot of insight out of it.

I think they give really good insight into what makes julia julia (type system, dispatch and so on).
Besides that i can really recommend reading the manual
It is really well written and since you’re all ready an experienced programmer will get a lot of insight out of it.

text: Thank You, I shall see these!

text: I started some months ago and ended up reading through most of the manual, but not at first… <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/getting-started/>
